meanings.def: a shape like a curve or circle made by a line curving right round
examples: The road went in a huge loop around the lake.
Duclair is a small town on a loop of the River Seine.

meanings.def: a piece of rope, wire, etc. in the shape of a curve or circle
examples: He tied a loop of rope around his arm.
Make a loop in the string.
a belt loop (= on trousers, etc. for holding a belt in place)

meanings.def: a long, narrow piece of film or tape on which the pictures and sound are repeated continuously
examples: The film is on a loop.
(figurative) His mind kept turning in an endless loop.
The audio tape runs in a continuous loop lasting thirty minutes.

meanings.def: a set of instructions that is repeated again and again until a particular condition is satisfied
a complete circuit for electrical current
a railway line or road that leaves the main track or road and then joins it again
the business centre of the US city of Chicago
part of a group of people that is dealing with something important; not part of this group
examples: A lot of people want to be in the loop on this operation.
Lawton had gradually been cut out of the loop on legal reviews.
The result of the election knocked most people for a loop.

idioms.idiom: in the loop | out of the loop
idioms.def: part of a group of people that is dealing with something important; not part of this group
examples: A lot of people want to be in the loop on this operation.
Lawton had gradually been cut out of the loop on legal reviews.
The result of the election knocked most people for a loop.

meanings.def: to form or bend something into a loop
examples: He looped the strap over his shoulder.
The horse’s reins were looped around its neck.

meanings.def: to move in a way that makes the shape of a loop
examples: The river loops around the valley.
The ball looped high up in the air.

meanings.def: to fly or make a plane fly in a circle going up and down

idioms.def: to fly or make a plane fly in a circle going up and down
